definition: ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: It turned out that a number of tribes in ancient China, there is looting marriage customs.
sentences.chinese: 原來，在古代中國的一些部落，有搶婚的習俗。

sentences.english: Wake AHu, fasten readme named one of poison arrow tribal leaders.
sentences.chinese: 醒來的人自述名叫阿虎，系箭毒部落領袖之一。

sentences.english: They were traditionally semisedentary, moving seasonally between fixed sites.
sentences.chinese: 他們是傳統的半定居部落，在定居點間季節性遷移。

sentences.english: In primitive tribes, dreams were thought to be the indication of God or the haunting of the devil.
sentences.chinese: 在原始部落中，夢被當成天神降臨或是妖魔附體。

sentences.english: Each Ojibwa tribe was divided into migratory bands.
sentences.chinese: 奧吉布瓦人各部落都分爲若干遷徙性家族。

sentences.english: Its only inhabitants were a few hunting and fishing tribes.
sentences.chinese: 當地唯一的住戶是幾個以打獵和捕魚爲生的部落。

sentences.english: Humans lived as roaming hunters and gatherers for most of their existence.
sentences.chinese: 當時的人類羣體絕大部分是以遊獵部落形式存在的。

sentences.english: These nationalisms, or tribalisms vary widely.
sentences.chinese: 這些民族主義或部落主義大相徑庭。

sentences.english: Upon arrival you will have the local kampong style breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 抵達後，體驗富有當地部落風俗的早餐。

sentences.english: Non-institutionalized control is the primary control manner of tribe society.
sentences.chinese: 非制度化控制是部落社會主要的控制方式。

sentences.english: Schools will help to civilize the wild tribes there.
sentences.chinese: 學校將有助於使那兒的野蠻部落文明化。

sentences.english: Enter Mongolia the empire big sweat in 1206, unify Mongolia each tribe.
sentences.chinese: 1206年，進位蒙古帝國年夜汗，同一蒙古各部落。

sentences.english: In 1969, Gadhafi overthrew the Eastern tribal King Idris.
sentences.chinese: 1969年，卡扎菲推翻了東部的部落酋長伊德里斯。

sentences.english: Most citizens of that little-known tribe are manikins .
sentences.chinese: 那個鮮爲人知的部落的大部分居民都是小矮人。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, a family with surname "Duan" from Dali, Yunnan Province, set up a clan named "Qiangzhong" here.
sentences.chinese: 從前，大理段氏在這個地方建立了“強宗”部落。

sentences.english: You're from the Warsong, are you not?
sentences.chinese: 你們是來自戰歌部落的嗎？

definition: nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
headman (of primitive people)/tribal chief/used as translation for foreign leaders, e.g. Indian Rajah or Arab Sheik or Emir
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
